description.narrative: This project aims to enhance national capacity to manage energy efficiently and address current gaps in the energy sector.
Energy Efficiency/ Renewable Energy Strategy/ Policy/ Action Plan in place with nationally adopted targets

comment.narrative: Currently the country does not have a coherent approach to address issues of sustainable energy; mainly energy efficiency and renewable energy. There is no National Energy Policy Paper; Energy Efficiency Strategy nor Renewable Energy Strategy. There are no national targets for energy efficiency or renewable energy.

Renewable energy % of total installed capacity o 2018 milestone:  Not a certain percentage was set to be achieved for 2018 itself, the target for renewable energy by 2025 is 5% which translates to 250MGW. On the assumption that the 5% would be achieved over 8 years as of 2017 when it was endorsed; it would have been 0.6% per year which if on the same assumption is at 31.25MGW, thus 0.6% for 2018. % of National energy efficiency (EE) targets that are set and achieved o 2018 milestone  Not a certain percentage was set to be achieved for 2018 itself, the target for renewable energy by 2025 is 6%. On the assumption that the 6% would be achieved over 8 years as of 2017 when it was endorsed; it would have been 0.75% per year. National Energy Efficiency Action Plan initiatives \ policies developed o 2018 milestone  Development of the Green Building code  Refurbishment of light bulbs in government buildings to LED  Installation of smart meters  Development \ improvement of MEPS and labeling for ACs  Development \ improvement of MEPS and labeling for appliances  Development \ improvement of MEPS and labeling for vehicles  Fuel subsidy reform  Electricity subsidy reform  Power factor correction National Renewable Energy Action Plan initiatives \ policies developed o 2018 milestone  Publishing of the Net Metering Policy and putting it into effect.  Enable and build local capacities for to support and encourage the uptake of renewable energy.  Development of wind atlas No. of Energy Efficiency sectoral initiatives implemented o 2018 milestone  2

Renewable energy % of total installed capacity o 2018 actual:  The recorded capacities and projects between those implemented and initiated are at around 131 MGW, which translate to 52% achievement of the target in 1 year so far through the following: • Large Scale Solar Farm –capacity of 100MGW • Tatweer Petroleum Project –capacity of 5MW • Electricity & Water Authority Project –capacity of 5MW • Awali Project –capacity of 5MW • Developers and Constructors Projects –capacity of 11MW (being 30% in progress projects out of 36.5MGW in pipeline)
% of National energy efficiency (EE) targets that are set and achieved o 2018 actual  No available figure due to the fact that the majority of the 22 initiatives are still establishing/implementing their Measurement and Verification protocols.
National Energy Efficiency Action Plan initiatives\policies developed o 2018 actual  The Green Building code has been developed and is being published 1st quarter of 2019  All light bulbs in government buildings were refurbished to LED  Over 300 smart meters were installed  MEPS and labeling for ACs have been implemented and non-compliant products are banned from entry in the market as of July 2018. A number of inspection campaigns were carried out by the implementing ministry  MEPS and labeling for some electric appliances was developed and an exhibition was done to raise public awareness. Please see attachment (MEPS EXHIBITION)  MEPS and labeling for vehicles were developed for the new models where fuel economy labels for vehicles & Energy efficiency label for tires imposed on 2018 Models, and inspection campaigns started for cars of 2018 models - ongoing- preliminary results showed 79% conformance of 160 models in 40 showrooms.  Fuel subsidy reform  Electricity subsidy reform  Installation of Power Factor Correction is now required for specific utility users and all commercial utility users are charge a penalty for excess reactive energy. As a result the uptake of Power Factor Correction is growing
National Renewable Energy Action Plan initiatives \ policies developed o 2018 actual  Net Metering policy was published and put into effect as of 1st January 2018.  A certification program to certify Solar PV installers, contractors and consultants was developed. Four batches of the program were delivered and have certified over 200 contractors and installers to operate and cater for the local renewable energy market.  More than 15 units have connected their solar PV systems to the grid and more than 10 are in the pipeline process.  Positive uptake and interest ministries wide.  Wind Atlas developed and launched
No. of Energy Efficiency sectoral initiatives implemented o 2018 actual  7

Renewable energy % of total installed capacity o 2019 milestone:  Not a certain percentage was set to be achieved for 2019 itself, the target for renewable energy by 2025 is 5% which translates to 250MWp and 10% by 2035 which with for casted growth amounts to 750MWp. o 2019 milestone  Not a certain percentage was set to be achieved for 2019 itself, the target for renewable energy by 2025 is 6%. On the assumption that the 6% would be achieved over 8 years as of 2017 when it was endorsed; it would have been 0.75% per year. National Energy Efficiency Action Plan initiatives \ policies developed o 2019 milestones 1. Minimum Energy Performance Standards & Labeling of Lighting maintained 2. Minimum Energy Performance Standards & Labeling of Air Conditioning maintained 3. Green Building Initiative (Green Building Code) publication and implementation (phase1) 4. District Cooling (regulation developed and ministerial decree establishing first national 1st refusal zone for District Cooling) 5. Industry Program (Industry A to make progress towards their commitment of 1% energy efficiency improvement year on year – Industry B Case study to be developed) 6. Street Lighting (National street lighting conversion to LED to continue) 7. Government Buildings Energy Management (Framework and case studies to be developed to ensure all government buildings have a strong EnMS strategy) 8. Green Public Procurement (Manual to be developed and advocated for with Ministry of Finance and National Economy) 9. Vehicle Efficiency Standards & Labeling maintained and reviewed 10. Transport Subsidy Reform maintained, and impact reviewed 11. Smart Metering implementation to continue 12. Electricity Subsidy Reform final phase implemented (5year plan), and impact reviewed 13. Institutional Infrastructure, permanent institution for Sustainable Energy to be established
National Renewable Energy Action Plan initiatives \ policies developed o 2019 milestone  Review of Published Net Metering Policy and its implementation, proposed net metering amendment to increase impact and uptake of Net Metering.  Developed with relevant ministries and council a Commercial Registration for Renewable Energy Companies and Contractors (currently being adopted pending final approvals).  Development of financing schemes with Sovereign Wealth Fund and Commercial banks to support sustainable energy projects
No. of Energy Efficiency sectoral initiatives implemented o 2019 milestone  13

Renewable energy % of total installed capacity o 2019 actual:  The recorded capacities and projects between those implemented and initiated or committed to are at around 175 MWp, which translate to 70% achievement of the target so far through the following: • Large Scale Solar Farm –capacity of 100MW • Tatweer Petroleum Project –capacity of 5MW • Electricity & Water Authority Project –capacity of 5MW • National Waste Management Strategy – Waste to Energy capacity of 50MW • Developers and Constructors Projects –capacity of 11MW (being 30% in progress projects out of 36.5MW in pipeline)
% of National energy efficiency (EE) targets that are set and achieved o 2019 actual  No available figure due to the fact that the majority of the 22 initiatives are still establishing/implementing their Measurement and Verification protocols.
National Energy Efficiency Action Plan initiatives\policies developed o 2019 actual  The Green Building code was finalized and published in the official Gazette October 2019  Over 300 smart meters were installed  MEPS and labeling for ACs have been implemented and non-compliant products are banned from entry in the market as of July 2018. A number of inspection campaigns were carried out by the implementing ministry  MEPS and labelling for vehicles were developed for the new models where fuel economy labels for vehicles & Energy efficiency label for tires imposed from 2018 models onwards and inspection campaigns started for cars of 2018 models - ongoing- preliminary results showed 79% conformance of 160 models in 40 showrooms.  Fuel subsidy reform  Electricity subsidy reform  Installation of Power Factor Correction is now required for specific utility users and all commercial utility users are charge a penalty for excess reactive energy. As a result, the uptake of Power Factor Correction is growing
National Renewable Energy Action Plan initiatives \ policies developed o 2019 actual  Net Metering policy was published and put into effect as of 1st January 2018.  A certification program to certify Solar PV installers, contractors and consultants was developed. Four batches of the program were delivered and have certified over 320 contractors and installers to operate and cater for the local renewable energy market.  More than 30 units have connected their solar PV systems to the grid and more than 10 are in the pipeline process.  Positive uptake and interest ministries wide.  A National Renewable Energy Certificate Program was designed and presented for approval at Executive Committee chaired by HH. The Crown Prince, it was approved in principal and a pilot is to be conducted in Q1 2020.  Renewable Energy Mandate was integrated as an optional aspect of the Green Building Code (EE initiative) at this stage requiring that large buildings conduct a feasibility study into renewable energy integration during the building permitting process – the intention is to both signal to the market that this may become mandatory in the near future and collect relevant information to inform such future policy.
No. of Energy Efficiency sectoral initiatives implemented o 2019 actual •  13 1. Minimum Energy Performance Standards & Labeling of Lighting a. Directional lighting fully covered 2. Minimum Energy Performance Standards & Labeling of Air Conditioning a. All small and medium A/C units included – currently working on standards for large and industrial units 3. Green Building Initiative (Green Building Code) a. Published in the Official Gazette and a complementary Green Building Rating Scheme is being developed for launch in Q1 2020 4. District Cooling a. A zone was highlighted as being the nation’s first area where district cooling must be used unless it is proven to be technically not feasible 5. Industry Program a. All Industry A companies made commitments to improve their Energy Efficiency by 1% year on year to reach the 6% target by 2025 – progress has been made in this regard by most b. A case study was developed and published in the local news papers demonstrating Energy Savings Opportunities and their financial impacts 6. Street Lighting conversion to LED ongoing 7. Government Buildings Energy Management a. Framework developed to implement EnMS in government buildings and a case study developed (to be finalized and shared with ministry of finance and national economy to advise future government investment in Energy Efficiency) 8. Green Public Procurement a. Manual developed (to be finalized and shared with ministry of finance and national economy to advise improved Energy Efficiency in future Public Procurement) Q1 2020 b. Manual once finalized to be shared with Private Sector Q2 2020 9. Vehicle Efficiency Standards & Labeling – Ongoing implementation 10. Transport Subsidy Reform – Ongoing implementation 11. Smart Metering – Ongoing implementation 12. Electricity Subsidy Reform – Ongoing implementation 13. Institutional Infrastructure a. Perhaps the most impactful of all achievements in 2019 is the establishment by Royal Decree of a Sustainable Energy Authority in the Kingdom Of Bahrain to report directly to Cabinet, with H.E. Dr. Abdul Hussain Bin Ali Mirza assigned as its President.

National Renewable Energy Action Plan (NREAP) initiatives / policies developed 2020 milestone targets: o Review of National Renewable Energy Action Plan and its implementation o Develop Policy Guidance Papers to stimulate further uptake of Renewable Energy Technologies o Develop with relevant authorities a Commercial Registration (CR) for Renewable Energy Consultants and Contractors o Complete any legal requirements to formalize the establishment of a CR and Commercial Activities in regard to Renewable Energy o Support Government in implementing Renewable Energy on Government Rooftop Projects via public tender o Support Government in developing Renewable Energy on Infrastructure and Public Works Projects o Support Government in assessing technical and financial viability of wind resources and support in the development of documents relating to procurement of Grid Scale Utility Generation from Wind Resources which are deemed viable o Promote the uptake of renewable energy technology in industrial facilities o Promote market stimulation through awareness raising, technical support and development of local technical capacity o Improve technical and financial viability of Renewable Energy Projects by advocating and implementing appropriate policies and platform
National Energy Efficiency Action Plan (NEEAP) initiatives / policies developed 2020 milestones targets: 1. Minimum Energy Performance Standards & Labeling of Large Air Conditioning Units 2. Regulation of District Cooling marketplace 3. Green Building Initiative - specifically Green Building Rating Scheme design and implementation as well as phase1 of Green Building Code implementation and follow up 4. Industry Program (Industry A to continue making progress towards their commitment of 1% energy efficiency improvement year on year – Industry B Case Study to be developed) 5. Street Lighting (National street lighting conversion to LED to continue) 6. Government Buildings Energy Management (Framework to be to implemented in government buildings to continue implementation of EnMS strategy, further case studies to be developed to increase uptake by more parties) 7. Green Public Procurement (Manual to be advocated for with Ministry of Finance and National Economy and integrated into standard financial manual) 8. Promote the uptake of energy efficiency technologies in industrial facilities 9. Promote market stimulation through awareness raising, technical support and development of local technical capacity 10. Review of National Energy Efficiency Action Plan and its implementation 11. Develop Policy Guidance Papers to stimulate further uptake of Energy Efficiency Technologies
